TRANSCRIPTION
Transcription It is simple.\n If audio/video file is not corrupted, decoding and transcription will start automatically.\n After conversion completes, it will offer to save the resulted MIDI-file.\n Then, you can go back to the main screen and MIDI will start playing automatically.
FFmpeg Could not understand what kind of media file it is
Duration %1$d min : %2$d sec\nFormat %3$s\n\nMeta data:\n%4$s\n\nStreams:\n%5$s Cancel Cancelled by user Successfully decoded media file Could not decode media file, probably because its format is not supported Could not find audio stream
Output from FFmpeg: File IO operation interrupted:\n\n%1$s
&memory;Could not read media file:\n\n%1$s &memory;Could not decode media file:\n\n%1$s &memory;Could not draw audio wave graph:\n\n%1$s
&memory;Could not draw piano-roll:\n\n%1$s Audio wave for the 1st second

compatible incompatible This device is GPU %1$s
Transcription completed :=) Transcription is still in progress. \nAre you sure you want to cancel it? Continue transcribing Save MIDI
Scale Key signature The scale does not correspond to any
USER GUIDE
Share Google Play App link with other people
Open any MIDI- or Karaoke-file or any other audio/video-file (such as MP3, MP4, etc.) or record a piano piece with microphone
The program will automatically transcribe audio and save as a MIDI-file However, no instrument information is extracted, and all transcribed notes get combined into one part. The accuracy depends on the complexity of the song, and is obviously higher for solo piano pieces. Accuracy for piano pieces is around 75%.
If you opened an existing MIDI-file, select tracks. Percussion-tracks (like “Drums”, “Rhythms”, “Hit”, “Blow”, “Strike”, “Clash”, etc.) will be disabled. For some MIDI-files downloaded from Internet, there can be dozens of tracks
If you want just to play the song in real time, tap in the upper-middle area of the screen. Or if you want to go forward or backwards chord-by-chord, you can pause and tap in the upper-left or upper-right areas of the screen
If you want to learn the MIDI chords on your real piano, you can use the real-time transcription feature Correctly played notes will be highlighted with green color, mistakes - with red
If somebody talks near your phone, or if you sit it in a loud environment, it will incorrectly recognize too many notes which you actually do not play. Too many keys will be red in this case and it will be annoying. \nSo, if you want better recognition accuracy, ideally there should be no other sounds than your piano If you have convenient headphones which you can connect to your electric piano, there is a life-hack - you can “put on headphones on mobile device” like on the following photo: Turn the volume louder
Ones you correctly play all the notes of the chord simultaneously (all of the pressed keys are green), it will automatically proceed to the next MIDI chord, and so on Enjoy!
